title: CryptopreneurBrainboss
author: CryptopreneurBrainboss
content: QuoteNigeria is struggling with severe cash shortages, with riots erupting across the country just days before a presidential election – but people are still not turning to the national digital currency, the eNaira, which promised to improve retail payments.The digital iteration of the naira, which was issued by the Central Bank of Nigeria in October 2021, hasn’t had the most impressive start and adoption has been slow. But even if people in Nigeria wanted to turn to the eNaira, transaction options with the central bank digital currency, or CBDC, are limited.Read more: https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2023/02/24/why-nigerians-arent-turning-to-the-enaira-despite-crippling-cash-shortages/?outputType=ampJust so una know, this wan no be another shortage of cash thread before una begin spam here. This thread came about as a result of why the Enaira aren't been used in the country even though the government been provide this solution wey before dem bring about the cashless policy matter. Why you think say this Enaira no dey get force for the country and it's already a failed project before e even stand. Wetin you think say the government fit do so their Enaira solution go help fit help us in this cashless economy as I believe if this Enaira been dey very active like people download and they use the wallet then we fit dey do transactions easily without even been worried about the banks and their problem or wetin una think?

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.created_time: March 02, 2023, 06:08:42 AMLast edit: March 02, 2023, 06:19:33 AM by Charles-Tim
comments.body: CBN lacks the capability to make Nigerians to know about eNaira, or maybe they do not want to go for the effective way because they do not want to spend, CBN lacks the capability because if they want full eNaira adoption by Nigerians, they should have started a full-scale campaign and other means of awareness rather than the Kano-state-like new naira note swap or distribution or whatever they called it. I have only knew of campaigns in just major markets in Lagos. If the campaigns were beyond those markets in Lagos and also to other states in Nigeria, including FCT, more people would have been using eNaira speed wallet by now. The campaign should also include teaching people what eNaira and eNaira speed wallet is about.Crypto users which have most likely chance to use it also prefer to stay away from CBN issues, or because exchanges and many other platforms are not yet supporting it. If it is supported by many crypto exchanges and platforms beyond exchanges, maybe that will also increase its adoption.Enaira and naira are the same, some people have many banks, presently that people can have online ones like Kuda, Opay, Palmpay and commercial bank accounts app, distributing their money in case if one does not work, the other would work. They already see the banks as more convenient way of making naira transaction, just like an organization that has been existing before to continue to grow as long as they are satisfying customers needs but with just little lapses which the customers do not consider as big issue as they think other banks are like that.Another are people that have the type of thinking that if they have eNaira wallet funded and they got issue with it and not able to spend (which I do not think is possible), that who are they going to complain to, that where are they going to complain. Some people may just prefer direct interaction with the bank. People need awareness and education about eNaira which may be possible with just CBN starting a full-scale campaign and other means of awareness.

I feel say another reason why people no they put eye for Enaira na because cryptocurrencies don already they very popular for Naija, thus people no wan use CBDC's at all because them no go fit make any ROI from am, and because e they centralized.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: -Charles-Tim -CryptopreneurBrainboss -Coaster Reading through the thread and the various comments from you guys, I have come to understand the fact that most of us still believe in the functionality of the current e-naira currency state of development, but recent development has pointed us in a different direction, far away from adoption from Nigerians into the functionality and addiqauncy of the e-naira to meet it designed purpose. and from sources around the CNB governor and the federal government have partnered with a new US-based tech company to work on developing and upgrading the E-naira which means that, the current e-naira. -This shows that the current stage of the e-naira design is not fit enough to be adopted as a digital currency to compete with other digital payments, even though there is the unavailability of a wallet since not many Nigerians can access it, and now CBN coming out to announce their partnerships again shows how the level of unfinished work that needs to be done with the development of the e-naira, so at this stage, I believe that the best possible awareness the CBN can do is to make the e-naira wallet more accessible to Nigeria to try the functionality and capabilities of the wallet and also collect feedback from the wallet users. -Note the news of the e-naira partnership is from unverified source but there is high possibility of the fact of the partnership considering, the state of the speed wallet which can't be install and operated by many Nigerians including myself. https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-02-21/nigeria-seeks-new-tech-partners-to-revamp-enaira-central-bank-digital-currency?leadSource=uverify%20wall

The idea of this eNaira really looked good when I first heard about it, and I just believed it was going to be a solution because some big shops and businesses will gladly adopt it and even have back codes in their offices that can be easily scanned to make payments, but all high hopes are lost. comments.body: In my own opinion I think CBN has failed to put in place the necessary measures for the eNaira to be accepted as a digital currency. The public enlightenment has been poor and this could be attributed to not wanting to spend money to promote it but they might still have another chance to get it right this time with the naira redesign. The scarcity of the naira notes have made businesses to be opting for different means of payment aside the traditional fiat and bank transfer, so it's another golden opportunity for eNaira to flourish if CBN can go back to the drawing board and correct their mistakes.
